Explanations about Options.-c(M):
Write the compressed or decompressed data to standard output instead of a file.
 This implies --keep.
Explanations about Options.-v(M):
Be verbose. If standard error is connected to a terminal, xz will display a
 progress indicator. Specifying --verbose twice will give even more verbose output.

Top-3 Scripts:
so_48452726: { tar -cvf - paths_to_archive | xz -1 -T0 -v > OUTPUT_FILE.tar.xz; } 2>Log_File

xz -v

{
  xz -1 -T0 -v > OUTPUT_FILE.tar.xz < <(tar -cvf - paths_to_archive) & xz_pid=$!
  while sleep 1; do
    kill -ALRM "$xz_pid" || break
  done
  wait "$xz_pid"
} 2>Log_File
